channel.title: Client plugin system
channel.description:
A while ago, me and Alex Levinson were discussing ideas for new and interesting features for RSC private servers. It's getting boring seeing the same thing over and over again. We had the idea of writing a plugin system for the client. It would give users limited access to the client, allowing them to write scripts similar to IRC bots. The bots could organize mini-games, trade, or act as 'buses' (like you used to see in RSC back when it was F2P). Ideally, it should be scriptable in a high-level language.
What are your thoughts?

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Kryptix:

It’s all very good talking the talk but it’s a bit different to actually go and do. I agree with you that RSCE’s code is bad, however it’s better than anything else that has ever been playable… It has been good enough to host a populated, playable server for the last 3 years and counting. The facts speak for themselves. Criticise it all you want but you haven’t done anything better and you never will.

Not saying that our server is better than RSCE(Untill we get actual proof), but it does run well on a 20$ VPS, we had 50 online today, with no latency increase at all. I’m excited to see more results when the server grows.

Read full topic

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

Not_a_bot:

Didn’t Zilent write RSCE…? Bad idea to imply such a thing really

RSCE is based off Reines’ RSCD which isn’t great. Yes it has changed a lot, and it’s the best version of Reines’ RSCD but ultimately it can be much better which is why Zilent refuses to work on it and has started his version of RSCD from scratch.

Read full topic

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

[quote=“Dgc2002, post:23, topic:444463”]For what its worth to anyone here I 100% vouch for amfg(… i’m 99.99999% sure he is who I think he is ) in his ability and personality. I say this because on this forum there seems to be a sort of… fog. A newer name comes out of the fog and the majority of people tend to pick on/troll/hate the person as if he some sort of enemy. So maybe this will help people see a little clearer.

… I really pushed that metaphor.[/quote]
I suggest you go through his posts and see how he decided to enter the community, flaming people etc. And why does he feel the need to hide behind a new identity?

Getting a little big-headed there aren’t you? It’s simply RSCD with a few changes. I’m pretty sure I can manage that

Go on then, let me know when you’re done…

You want me to create amfg’s idea because you want proof that it can be done? You really don’t know what you’re doing if you don’t think that it would work… Lol.

I never said it can’t be done…? I said no one is going to do it. It’s not viable. No one would develop plug-ins for a shit bot. What server would the ‘client’ (bot) be for?

[quote=“Outspoken, post:15, topic:444528”]So. I’ve said all I can say here. Read this last post and post again yourself, for that false sense that you’ve won, and walk away.
Arguing with idiots as proven, is a complete waste of time. I’d rather not waste anymore time on you.[/quote]
Because you’re backed into a corner like always. You get to this point and then pretend you’re being the bigger man.

We both know this will never happen. We both know this is completely pointless. We both know there’s no active server for this client to be made for. We both know the end user would sooner use a bot that isn’t restricted on what it can and can’t do over a client that only allows them to do certain things.

As I’ve said all along, feel free to prove me wrong…

Read full topic

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

Your player count has nothing to do with how good/bad your server source is (code wise).

It’s all very good talking the talk but it’s a bit different to actually go and do. I agree with you that RSCE’s code is bad, however it’s better than anything else that has ever been playable… It has been good enough to host a populated, playable server for the last 3 years and counting. The facts speak for themselves. Criticise it all you want but you haven’t done anything better and you never will.

Prove you wrong about what?

You seem to think it’s a good idea so go and do it. It’s all too easy to talk about it. Your argument is that no bot developer has ever made a bot to organise wars, even though no client plugin developer has ever made a plugin to organise wars either… It just doesn’t make sense.

As per usual, this thread will get pushed into Mopar’s old pages and nothing will ever come of it. Silly me for thinking a restricted bot is a bad idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Kryptix:

[quote author=Outspoken link=topic=547153.msg4013022#msg4013022 date=1339381312]Judging by that monstrosity you call “RSCE”, I have to say you have absolutely no idea what-so-ever about the “right way” to do anything.

You’re indirectly criticising every other attempt because it’s undoubtedly the most successful over the years… Many others have tried and failed.

And I agree, it could be a whole lot better. But it’s still the best yet.

As I said, prove me wrong. We’re waiting. :)[/quote]Don’t you get it? A client plugin to organise wars would easily make whichever server it’s implemented on an instant success!

You know this because you know java, right?

Please, prove me wrong…

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Outspoken, post:11, topic:444528”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=547153.msg4012954#msg4012954 date=1339374379]

[quote author=Outspoken link=topic=547153.msg4012942#msg4012942 date=1339372958]

It would give users limited access to the client, allowing them to write scripts similar to IRC bots. The bots could organize mini-games, trade, or act as ‘buses’ (like you used to see in RSC back when it was F2P). Ideally, it should be scriptable in a high-level language.

Additionally, what bot in the history of Runescape have you seen only do half of the tedious work?
[/quote]Exactly. So you’re idea is just a shitty bot. I don’t see the purpose for this at all to be honest.

Honestly who cares if you don’t see the point…?
[/quote]No, it’s just a limited bot. It’s a terrible idea, why can’t you just admit it?

There isn’t any unfair advantages, any type of threat (lack of a better word) to the economy, and it does less than half of the work than what you would consider a “bot”.

Additionally, in what bot have you seen any type of system that organizes wars, and things of that nature? What is the name of this bot, and what is the developers name?[/quote]What do you mean by organizing wars?

Read full topic

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Outspoken, post:7, topic:444528”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=547153.msg4012615#msg4012615 date=1339351337]

The point, which I mentioned earlier, is to make tasks less tedious. Meaning there is no need for bots. Yes, there will be bots and there is literally nothing I, or anyone can do about that. There are people out there who simply like reverse engineering… It doesn’t mean it will become some epidemic like your bot problem on RSCE, or STS/google with RSC.
[/quote]So basically a shitty bot is your idea? Sounds like users are extremely limited to what scripts they can write and will run out quick. If you’re just talking about mine X or whatever, it’s not hard for the developer to do it. This idea just needlessly overcomplicates things and would be a waste of time to implement.

Lol… No.[/quote][quote=“Outspoken, post:1, topic:444528”]I think the idea could make it easier for players. Think of RS2 “fletch X bows”, "mine X ore, “catch X fish”, “sell/buy X item for X amount” (good for merchants for example), etc. Less people would resort to bots.[/quote]

So what else would they be able to do besides this? Auto walkers, talkers, bankers, etc? Sounds just like a bot.

Read full topic

There are people out there who simply like reverse engineering… It doesn’t mean it will become some epidemic like your bot problem on RSCE, or STS/google with RSC.[/quote]So basically a shitty bot is your idea? Sounds like users are extremely limited to what scripts they can write and will run out quick. If you’re just talking about mine X or whatever, it’s not hard for the developer to do it. This idea just needlessly overcomplicates things and would be a waste of time to implement.

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

Limited access. Read the first post.

That’s exactly what I mean, we presume access wouldn’t be allowed to walk and bank meaning the ‘Y things’ are not possible, but easily modified to be possible with a bot… Any bot maker has been able to completely modify the client, Reines noticeably making everyone speak who was using STS on RSC yet no one really does anything of interest. Probably the best attempt was for RSCE, allowing other IRC members to respond on your behalf and control what you do/say remotely if a staff member was detected in the area.

Unless the bot was for a populated server no one is going to bother wasting time making scripts anyway and those capable would just modify the client itself if they cared enough.

It’s another one of those ideas that gets thought up and posted on Mopar but never progresses.

Read full topic

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

What exactly would these “Y things” be?

Well if they can’t walk to the bank then there’d be something in place to not allow the script to do that, so that would be a ‘Y thing’

Using your logic, the user could use a bot anyways with “batch skills”. The point of the idea is to make the game less tedious.

So the developer should add batching to everything instead of basically saying botting is allowed IMO. What do I know though…

Read full topic

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

So it would be a little script system that allowed them to do X things but not Y things? Seems pointless when they could just decompile it and modify it to allow them to do Y things or just use another RSCD/RSCA bot themselves.

If it’s gunna mainly be used for doing batch skills it would make more sense for the developer to just include that in the base release and make it toggle-able for those who disapprove or whatever.

Read full topic

item.title: Client plugin system
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

Isn’t it basically a bot though? After the “mine X ore, catch X fish” it would be “walk to bank” etc.

Read full topic
